title: Milestone 2: Pattern Detection
description: Pure functions to detect iCloud conflict patterns and derive original filenames. Files: src/pattern.rs

title: Track skipped files instead of silent continue
description: Err(_) => continue silently swallows errors. Should track skipped files in report or return them.

title: Add named constant for MIN_CONFLICT_INDEX
description: Magic number 2 in pattern detection. Should be a named constant explaining why index >= 2.

title: Remove migrated recipes from monolith justfile
description: Final cleanup after all modules are working

title: Milestone 4: Scanner
description: Walk directory tree, find conflict candidates, verify originals, validate hashes. Files: src/scanner.rs
close_reason: Scanner module complete with 8 tests, proper TDD workflow (RED→GREEN→REFACTOR)

title: Parallelize verification loop with rayon
description: The verify_candidate() loop in scan example is embarrassingly parallel - each candidate hashes independent files. Use rayon's par_iter() for significant speedup on large scans.
close_reason: Implemented with rayon par_iter(). Seeing 355% CPU utilization on scan.

title: Milestone 1: Domain Types
description: Define the language of the problem. No logic yet. Files: src/types.rs. Deliverables: ConflictPattern, ConflictCandidate, ContentHash, VerificationResult, FileKind, QuarantineReceipt, ScanReport

title: Make normalize_path pure (return warnings as data)
description: normalize_path() currently prints warnings via eprintln - violates FP principle. Should return warnings as data, let caller decide to print.

title: Milestone 1: Domain Types
description:
Define the language of the problem. No logic yet.

Files: src/types.rs

Deliverables:
- ConflictPattern enum
- ConflictCandidate struct  
- ContentHash newtype
- VerificationResult enum (ConfirmedDuplicate, Orphaned, Diverged)
- FileKind enum (Regular, Bundle, CloudPlaceholder)
- QuarantineReceipt struct
- ScanReport struct

Verification:
- cargo check passes
- Types compile and are well-documented

NOTE: No tests in this milestone. Types ARE the specification.
Tests begin at Milestone 2 when implementation starts.

title: Pass 1: Type names only
Pass 2: Relationships
description:
Define which types reference which - still no internal fields.

Example: ConflictCandidate contains a ConflictPattern
Example: VerificationResult references ContentHash
Example: ScanReport contains collections of results

Goal: See the type graph emerge. cargo check passes.

title: Pass 3: Enum variants
description:
Fill in enum variants, but no fields yet.

ConflictPattern: Copy, Numbered
VerificationResult: ConfirmedDuplicate, OrphanedConflict, ContentDiverged
FileKind: Regular, Bundle, CloudPlaceholder

Goal: The shape of sum types is clear. cargo check passes.

title: Pass 4: Fields and attributes
description:
Fill in all struct fields and enum variant data.

Add PathBuf, ContentHash bytes, timestamps, etc.
Add derive macros (Debug, Clone, etc.)
Add documentation comments.

Goal: Types are complete and production-ready. cargo check passes.

title: Milestone 3: File Hashing
description: Compute content hash for files using BLAKE3. Files: src/hash.rs

title: Milestone 5: Reporting
description:
Transform scan results into human-readable output.

Files: src/report.rs

Types used:
- ScanReport: input data
- OutputFormat: Human or Json

Functions:
- fn format_report(report: &ScanReport, format: OutputFormat) -> String

Human format example:
  Found 5 duplicate groups (12 files, 45.2 MB recoverable)
  
  ✓ document.pdf (3 copies)
    keep: ~/Documents/document.pdf
    remove: ~/Documents/document Copy.pdf
    remove: ~/Documents/document Copy 2.pdf

JSON format: machine-readable for scripting/piping.

Testing:
- Unit tests with snapshot/golden file approach
- Given ScanReport, verify output string
- No side effects — pure transformation

Pure code — straightforward unit tests.

title: Add missing config types
description:
Add configuration types discovered during review:

Added to src/types.rs:
- OutputFormat: Human (default), Json
- ScanConfig: roots, max_depth, follow_symlinks, include_hidden, case_insensitive
- QuarantineConfig: quarantine_dir, dry_run, preserve_structure

All with sensible defaults via Default impl.

These complete the domain vocabulary before implementation begins.

title: Milestone 4: Scanner
description:
Walk directory tree, find conflict candidates, verify originals, validate hashes.

Files: src/scanner.rs
Dependencies: walkdir

Types used:
- ScanConfig: roots, max_depth, follow_symlinks, include_hidden, case_insensitive
- ConflictCandidate: detected conflicts before verification
- VerificationResult: outcome after hash comparison
- ScanReport: aggregated results

Functions:
- fn scan(config: &ScanConfig) -> io::Result<ScanReport>

Internal steps:
1. Walk directories per ScanConfig
2. Filter by conflict patterns (uses pattern.rs)
3. Check if presumed original exists
4. Hash both files if original exists (uses hash.rs)
5. Classify result: ConfirmedDuplicate / OrphanedConflict / ContentDiverged
6. Aggregate into ScanReport

Testing:
- Integration tests with temp directory structures
- Create known conflict files, verify detection
- Test bundle detection (.pages, .app directories)
- Test .icloud placeholder detection

I/O-heavy — integration tests with real (temp) filesystems.

title: Operations: Reporting, Quarantine & CLI
description: User-facing layer. Output formatting, file operations (quarantine/restore/purge), and CLI interface.

title: Create modules/claude/plugins.just with claude-plugins, claude-marketplaces, claude-dev-browser-* recipes
Create modules/claude/mcp.just with fs-explorer-*, dbhub-* recipes
Foundation: Domain Model & Pattern Logic
description: Pure domain layer. Types that model the problem space and pattern detection logic. No I/O, fully testable in isolation.

title: Milestone 5: Reporting
description: Transform scan results into human-readable output (pretty + JSON). Files: src/report.rs

title: Milestone 7: CLI
description:
Wire everything together with a proper CLI interface.

Files: src/main.rs, src/cli.rs
Dependencies: clap

Subcommands:
- scan <path> — detect and report (no modifications)
- quarantine <path> — move duplicates to quarantine
- restore [--all | <id>] — restore from quarantine
- purge — permanently delete quarantined files
- status — show quarantine contents

Testing:
- End-to-end tests with assert_cmd crate
- Create test directory, run CLI, verify output
- Test error handling and edge cases
- Manual testing on real iCloud directories

CLI glue — end-to-end tests verify full pipeline.

title: Milestone 7: CLI
description: Wire everything together with clap CLI. Subcommands: scan, quarantine, restore, purge, status. Files: src/main.rs

title: Milestone 3: File Hashing
description:
Compute content hash for a file.

Files: src/hash.rs
Dependencies: blake3

Functions:
- fn hash_file(path: &Path) -> io::Result<ContentHash>
- fn files_match(a: &Path, b: &Path) -> io::Result<bool>

Testing:
- Unit tests with temp files
- Verify identical content → identical hash
- Verify different content → different hash

Pure logic with read effects — unit tests with fixtures.

title: Milestone 6: Quarantine
description:
Move duplicates to quarantine, write manifest, support restore.

Files: src/quarantine.rs
Dependencies: serde, serde_json, dirs

Functions:
- fn quarantine_files(groups: &[DuplicateGroup], config: &QuarantineConfig) -> Result<Manifest>
- fn restore_file(receipt: &QuarantineReceipt) -> Result<()>
- fn purge_quarantine(manifest: &Manifest) -> Result<()>
- fn get_quarantine_dir() -> PathBuf

Testing:
- Integration tests with temp directories
- Verify manifest written correctly (JSON roundtrip)
- Verify restore works (file returns to original path)
- Verify purge deletes files

Destructive I/O — careful integration tests, verify idempotency.

title: Milestone 6: Quarantine
description: Move duplicates to quarantine, write manifest, support restore/purge. Files: src/quarantine.rs

title: Verification: Hashing & Scanning
description: Read-only filesystem layer. Content hashing and directory scanning to find and validate duplicate candidates.
close_reason: Both milestones complete: M3 (Hashing, 7 tests) and M4 (Scanner, 8 tests)

title: Milestone 2: Pattern Detection
description:
Given a filename, detect conflict patterns and derive presumed original.

Files: src/pattern.rs

Functions:
- fn detect_pattern(filename: &str) -> Option<ConflictPattern>
- fn derive_original(path: &Path, pattern: &ConflictPattern) -> PathBuf
- fn is_conflict_file(filename: &str) -> bool

Pattern matching considerations:
- Case insensitive: "foo Copy.txt" and "foo copy.txt" both match
- Locale variants: Consider "Copie" (French), other localizations (future)
- Edge cases: "Copy.txt" (no base name), leading/trailing spaces

Testing (STARTS HERE):
- Unit tests for all patterns
- Property tests for roundtrip invariants
- Edge cases: "Copy.txt", "foo copy.txt" (lowercase), "  Copy 2.txt" (spaces)

This is pure code — ideal for property-based testing.
